title: ICE on malformed function signature (ident only path)
body:
This minimal example lets the compiler crash:

```
fn bug(Type<T>, arg: Type);
```

this doesn’t happen with the following code:

```
fn bug(Type, arg: Type);
```

trace:

```
test.rs:1:8: 1:12 error: internal compiler error: ident only path should have been covered already
test.rs:1 fn bug(Type<T>, arg: Type);
                 ^~~~
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', /Users/rustbuild/src/rust-buildbot/slave/nightly-dist-rustc-mac/build/src/libsyntax/diagnostic.rs:129

stack backtrace:
   1:        0x112422be3 - sys::backtrace::write::hc8e3cee73e646c590nC
```
